intro: Paronychia rugelii var. interior, commonly known as the interior paronychia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent characteristics and ability to store water in its leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pink or purple, adding ornamental value to gardens. It is often cultivated for its drought tolerance and unique appearance.
